item.title: "Bowled Really Nicely": Steve Smith's Big Praise For Star India Pacer. It's Not Jasprit Bumrah - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Bowled Really Nicely: Steve Smith's Big Praise For Star India Pacer. It's Not Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Australia's Steve Smith praised Indian pacer Akash Deep for his impressive bowling performance during the third Test, highlighting his skill and movement of the ball, despite not taking any wickets.

  • Akash Deep received high praise from Steve Smith despite not taking wickets in the third Test.
  • Smith scored his 33rd Test century and added 241 runs for the fourth wicket with Travis Head.
  • Smith noted the significant movement and good length bowled by Akash Deep during the match.
  • Australia ended the day at 405 for seven with Alex Carey contributing significantly.
  • Smith discussed his batting strategy and adjustments made during the match against Indian bowlers.
"I thought Akash bowled really nicely, particularly that first spell. He was getting the ball to move with pretty significant movement. He's a nice bowler." - Steve Smith

This match showcased the competitive spirit between Australia and India, with Smith reflecting on the team's turnaround after a previous loss, emphasizing the importance of adapting to bowling strategies.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 3rd Test Day 2: AUS 405/7 vs IND at Stumps in Brisbane - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 3rd Test Day 2: AUS 405/7 vs IND at Stumps in Brisbane

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Indian Express

Australia dominated Day 2 of the Test match against India, reaching 405/7 at stumps, bolstered by strong performances from Steven Smith and Travis Head.

  • Jasprit Bumrah was a standout for India, claiming five wickets.
  • India opted to bowl first after winning the toss, but rain limited play to just 13.4 overs on Day 1.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1, with India winning the first Test and Australia winning the second.
  • Ravindra Jadeja's inclusion in the playing XI was a significant talking point leading into the Test.
"The Gabba pitch is expected to offer assistance to spinners later in the match, particularly if rain delays persist." - Indian Express

The match is shaping up to be a thrilling contest as both teams showcase their strengths, with the series evenly poised.

item.title: The Oval, Ahmedabad, Adelaide, Brisbane: Travis Head continues to leave India clueless - The Times of India
item.description:
The Oval, Ahmedabad, Adelaide, Brisbane: Travis Head continues to leave India clueless

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: Times of India

Travis Head's impressive performance in recent matches has left the Indian cricket team struggling to find a way to tackle his aggressive batting style, raising concerns about their strategies moving forward.

  • Travis Head entered the game with high confidence after scoring a century in the previous pink-ball Test.
  • India's bowlers struggled to contain runs and failed to apply sustained pressure during crucial periods of play.
  • India's bowling coach, Morne Morkel, acknowledged issues in executing their game plans against Head.
  • Head's scoring impact is significant, having scored 392 runs in four innings, with a strike rate of nearly 95.
  • Steve Smith highlighted that the current Kookaburra ball's properties favor aggressive batting, benefiting players like Head.
"Yes we've got the game plans, but are we executing those game plans with a softer ball from both ends, that's something we need to discuss and get better at," said Morkel.

The Indian cricket team needs to reassess their approach to handling Travis Head, as their current strategies have proven ineffective, risking further heavy defeats in upcoming matches.

item.title: WPL 2025 mini auction Live updates: Deandra Dottin joins Gujarat Giants for 1.7 crores - Hindustan Times
item.description:
WPL Auction Highlights: Gujarat break the bank for Simran, Dottin; Sneh Rana goes unsold

Publication Date: December 15, 2024   |   Source: Hindustan Times

The WPL Auction took place in Bengaluru, where significant player purchases were made, including Simran Shaikh and Deandra Dottin by Gujarat Giants for ₹1.9 and ₹1.7 Crores respectively, while veteran Sneh Rana went unsold.

  • Gujarat Giants made the biggest splashes, acquiring Simran Shaikh for ₹1.9 Crores and Deandra Dottin for ₹1.7 Crores.
  • A total of 120 players were up for auction, with only a fraction expected to be sold.
  • Other notable purchases include G Kamalini by Mumbai Indians for ₹1.6 Crores and Prema Rawat by Royal Challengers Bengaluru for ₹1.2 Crores.
  • Several players went unsold including Sneh Rana, highlighting the unpredictability of the auction.
“Simran is the most expensive buy in this auction with GG spending 1.9 Cr on her.”

The auction showcased a mix of high-profile transactions and surprises, with teams aiming to strengthen their squads ahead of the league season.

item.title: Gukesh Wins 2024 FIDE World Championship — 13 Conclusions - Chess.com
item.description:
```html

Gukesh Wins 2024 FIDE World Championship — 13 Conclusions

Publication Date: December 13, 2024

Source: Chess.com

The era of India's GM Gukesh Dommaraju as chess world champion has begun after he secured victory at the 2024 FIDE World Championship, ending in a dramatic conclusion due to a blunder by the reigning champion Ding Liren.

  • Gukesh becomes the 18th World Chess Champion at the age of 18.
  • His victory was the realization of a long-held dream to bring the title back to India.
  • The match was competitive, with several games filled with tension and strategy.
  • The final game concluded unexpectedly with a mistake by Ding leading to Gukesh's victory.
  • Gukesh's mental strength and thorough preparation played crucial roles in his success.
  • Ding Liren demonstrated impressive gameplay but struggled with self-belief at crucial moments.
  • Gukesh had a strong team of supporters and coaches aiding his preparation for the championship.
  • Gukesh’s victory is seen as a positive milestone for the game of chess.

“When Magnus won, I thought I really want to be the one to bring back the title to India.”

—Gukesh Dommaraju

In conclusion, Gukesh's triumph not only marks a personal achievement but also represents a significant moment in chess history, inspiring future generations of players.

```

item.title: WPL Auction Live Updates: Gujarat break the bank for Simran, Dottin; MI win bidding war for Kamalini - Hindustan Times
item.description:
WPL Auction Live Updates: Gujarat break the bank for Simran, Dottin; MI win bidding war for Kamalini

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Hindustan Times

The Women's Premier League (WPL) auction is taking place in Bengaluru, where Gujarat Giants made significant acquisitions by purchasing Simran Shaikh and Deandra Dottin for ₹1.9 and ₹1.7 crores, respectively.

  • Gujarat Giants acquired Simran Shaikh for ₹1.9 crore from a base price of ₹10 lakhs.
  • Deandra Dottin was purchased by Gujarat for ₹1.7 crores.
  • Mumbai Indians won a bidding war for Kamalini at ₹1.6 crore, with a base price of ₹10 lakhs.
  • A total of 120 players were shortlisted for the auction.
  • Gujarat Giants entered the auction with ₹4.40 crore and 4 remaining slots, including 2 overseas players.
  • The tournament is expected to start in the third week of January 2025.
“The auction format allows for lesser-known players to suddenly become amongst the most talked-about athletes in the country.”

In conclusion, the WPL auction has seen major transactions, with teams strategically bolstering their rosters ahead of the upcoming season. The decisions made during this auction could greatly impact the competitive landscape of the league.

item.title: India needs to get better with old ball between overs 50-80, accepts bowling coach Morkel - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India needs to get better with old ball between overs 50-80, accepts bowling coach Morkel

Date: October 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bowling coach Morne Morkel has acknowledged that Indian bowlers need to improve their performance with the old ball, especially during the critical overs 50 to 80, following a disappointing session against Australian batsman Travis Head.

  • Morkel emphasized the need to execute plans effectively during the latter part of the innings.
  • Australia accumulated 171 runs in the third session, finishing the day at 405 for seven.
  • Jasprit Bumrah stood out with a five-wicket haul, while other bowlers struggled.
  • Morkel backed Ravindra Jadeja despite his tough outing in the match.
  • He defended the decision to bowl first, believing in the team's ability to control the run rate.
“It’s definitely an area that we need to focus on, maybe deeper in the innings. Yes, we’ve got the game plans, but are we executing those game plans with a softer ball from both ends?” - Morne Morkel

In summary, Morkel's critiques underscore the necessity for improvement in India's bowling strategy with the old ball, especially against skilled opponents like Australia. The team must adapt swiftly to bolster their performance in the ongoing series.

item.title: Watch: Mohammed Siraj's Act Leaves Ravindra Jadeja Fuming, Earns Him A Mouthful During 3rd Test Agai.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Mohammed Siraj's Act Leaves Ravindra Jadeja Fuming, Earns Him A Mouthful During 3rd Test Against Australia

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Mohammed Siraj's reckless throw during the third Test against Australia sparked frustration from Ravindra Jadeja, highlighting a tense moment on the field as the match progressed.

  • Siraj's aggressive throw caused Jadeja to react angrily during Day 2 of the Test in Brisbane.
  • Former England cricketer Mark Nicholas noted the "civil war" on the field as Jadeja chastised Siraj for his throw.
  • Australia dominated the day, reaching 405/7 at stumps, with significant contributions from Travis Head and Steve Smith.
  • Head scored 152 runs and Smith made 101 runs, both forming a crucial partnership in the middle order.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was India's standout bowler, achieving figures of 5-72.

“You almost broke my finger, pal. Take it easy,” said Ravindra Jadeja in response to Siraj's throw.

The match highlighted India's struggles with bowling depth and field settings, leading to a disappointing performance against Australia.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah abused with racial slur as Isa Guha calls him 'primate' on air - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah abused with racial slur as Isa Guha calls him 'primate' on air

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Former England cricketer Isa Guha ignited controversy during commentary by referring to Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah with a racially insensitive term on air, drawing backlash and comparisons to previous racist incidents in cricket.

  • During a commentary session on Day 2 of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Guha called Bumrah a "primate".
  • Her remark followed praise from Brett Lee, who commended Bumrah's performance after he took two Australian wickets.
  • This incident drew comparisons to the 2008 'MonkeyGate' controversy involving Harbhajan Singh.
  • Bumrah's performance included the dismissal of Travis Head and Steve Smith, crucial wickets as Australia finished Day 2 at 405/7.
"Well, he's the MVP, isn't he? Most valuable primate, Jasprit Bumrah."

The commentary sparked significant outrage, highlighting ongoing issues of racism within the sport and igniting discussions about the responsibility of broadcasters and commentators in addressing sensitive topics.

item.title: Why X users are congratulating Nirmala Sitharaman over world chess champion D Gukesh's win - ThePrint
item.description:
Why X users are congratulating Nirmala Sitharaman over world chess champion D Gukesh's win

Publication Date: December 13, 2024 Source: The Print

Following D. Gukesh's historic win as the youngest World Chess Champion at 18, congratulatory messages have flooded in for both the champion and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, sparking a wave of humorous commentary on social media about India’s tax policies.

  • D. Gukesh became the youngest-ever World Chess Champion, dethroning Ding Liren.
  • Congratulations were directed not only to Gukesh but also to the income tax department and Nirmala Sitharaman.
  • Gukesh's total earnings from the championship amount to about ₹11.45 crore.
  • The tax implications could result in a substantial tax liability of over ₹4.67 crore for Gukesh.
  • Social media users have turned the victory into a 'tax-themed' meme fest, humorously referring to the income tax department's share of winnings.
“Income Tax Department actually won the game without even playing 🤣” — Gokulnath

The lighthearted take on Gukesh's win illustrates how India intertwines sports victories with discussions about taxation, showcasing the nation’s unique blend of humor and seriousness regarding finances.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah targeted with racially-sensitive comment on air as Isa Guha sparks 'Monkeygate' fear - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah targeted with racially-sensitive comment on air as Isa Guha sparks 'Monkeygate' fear

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Former England cricketer Isa Guha faced backlash after making a racially sensitive comment about India's Jasprit Bumrah during commentary of the third Test match against Australia.

  • Isa Guha described Jasprit Bumrah as a “primate” during the commentary, which sparked outrage on social media.
  • The remark came after Bumrah's impressive performance, where he got two quick wickets early in the match.
  • Fans recalled the 2008 'Monkeygate' incident involving Harbhajan Singh, which added to the controversy surrounding Guha's comment.
  • Brett Lee praised Bumrah’s performance, highlighting his bowling stats for the day.
  • Bumrah achieved his 12th career five-wicket haul and has taken a total of 17 wickets in the series.
“He’s the MVP, isn’t he? Most valuable primate, Jasprit Bumrah." - Isa Guha

This incident has reignited discussions about racial sensitivity in sports commentary, particularly in light of past controversies. Fans continue to voice their opinions on social media regarding the appropriateness of Guha's statement.

item.title: 'Resign immediately': Rohit Sharma under fire as Australia dominate India at The Gabba - The Times of India
item.description:
'Resign immediately': Rohit Sharma under fire as Australia dominate India at The Gabba

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma is facing significant backlash after India's underwhelming performance in the ongoing third Test against Australia at The Gabba, with fans questioning his captaincy decisions as Australia gains control of the match.

  • India won the toss and chose to field, a decision criticized by many fans.
  • At 297/3 in 80 overs, Australia's strong batting performance has intensified scrutiny on Rohit's decisions.
  • Fans are vocal about their dissatisfaction, with calls for Rohit's resignation trending on social media.
  • The team's inability to capitalize on key moments has compounded criticism of Rohit's leadership.
“He's just not meant for this job, he needs to accept it and resign immediately after this Test irrespective of the outcome of this match.”

As the Test match progresses, the pressure on Rohit Sharma continues to mount, leading to serious questions about his future as captain and the overall leadership direction of Indian cricket.

item.title: India vs Australia: Matthew Hayden slams Marnus Labuschagne for losing focus after Mohammed Siraj's bail - The Times of India
item.description:
India vs Australia: Matthew Hayden slams Marnus Labuschagne for losing focus after Mohammed Siraj's bail flip

Publication Date: NEW DELHI | Source: Times of India

Former Australia batter Matthew Hayden criticized Marnus Labuschagne for losing focus after Mohammed Siraj's playful antics during the Brisbane Test.

  • During Day 2 of the Brisbane Test, Siraj attempted to distract batsmen, notably flipping the bails at Labuschagne's end.
  • Labuschagne responded by switching the bails back, shortly before he was dismissed for 12 runs off 55 balls.
  • Hayden, commentating on Star Sports, emphasized that Labuschagne should have remained composed and not acknowledged Siraj's actions.
  • The five-match series is currently tied at 1-1.
"He saw 55 deliveries, has had no go forward whatsoever... if it was me at the crease and a bowler does that, I'm not even looking at the bowler." - Matthew Hayden

Hayden's comments highlight the importance of maintaining focus during intense matches, particularly in the competitive environment of Test cricket.
